title: [Identified] From a visual novel
content:
Please help me identify the font used in the opening of a certain visual novel (book-style video game).  
Attached are the example files. Sorry if they are low-res, as that is all what’s available.  
As the game is in Japanese, the last example image is a kana\kanji string. I don’t know but maybe it might be of use too.  
Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font\_nakazawa.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/typophile.com/files/font_nakazawa.png) | 3.84 KB |
| [font\_fragment.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/typophile.com/files/font_fragment.png) | 5.86 KB |
| [font\_onoken.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/typophile.com/files/font_onoken.png) | 4.24 KB |
| [font\_rights.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/typophile.com/files/font_rights.png) | 5.04 KB |
| [font\_kakushite.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/typophile.com/files/font_kakushite.png) | 15.77 KB |
author: noiz_

comments.content:
It reminds me of ITC Bolt, but it’s thinner and has a different ’a’.

- Lex

Thanks for the suggestion. Nevermind, though, since I think I’ve found out (however accidentally) what it was.

[http://www.linotype.com/110735/dfsogeijapanese-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/www.linotype.com/110735/dfsogeijapanese-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/110735/dfsogeijapanese-family.html")  
 [http://www.ascenderfonts.com/font/df-so-gei-w-5-japanese.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20090918233559/http:/www.ascenderfonts.com/font/df-so-gei-w-5-japanese.aspx "http://www.ascenderfonts.com/font/df-so-gei-w-5-japanese.aspx")

One thing that I find different there is the height, but I guess the game makers might just had stretched it as they saw fit.
